column4: with server (which you DON'T want)  <- what don't you want, the server-kernel or server-installation?
for a desktop install - server is NOT the way to go PERIOD.  I see people installing server then installing Gnome and I shake my head...
let me rephrase it: you meant ubuntu-server installation on desktop, not installing linux-image-server as a package. so ACK
i was referring to "Ubuntu Server Install" not kernel - but I don't know why you'd want the kernel either (but it's not "as-bad" an idea)
linux-image-server = pae (just found out, it was rename to generic-pae in karmic)
not a problem, default here (de keyboard) ;)
great minds think alike.  and simple minds think the same ;)
too early to type + read at the same time ;(
i've tried -l (and assumed -a should work as well) but it's still copying the content from the linked directory?
i'm currently using "rsync -rluzv --delete foo bar" and bar is getting a large symlinked directory from foo, which points to a directory outside foo's tree?
(do not sort) thats "man ls" not "man ln"
ooops.  Thanks.  I'll blame it on not having a coffee yet ;)  dougl
